intro: Gnidia sparrmanni, commonly known as the yellow star, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, daisy-like flowers. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and has a woody stem with broad, lance-shaped leaves. It produces small, oval fruits that contain numerous seeds. Gnidia sparrmanni is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to sandy soils and full sun.
